alert.note: Alert for Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued July 24 at 2:47AM MDT until July 25 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE DECKER, HAYDEN PASS, JUNKINS AND SPRING BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall will be possible over and near the Decker, Hayden Pass, Junkins and Spring burn scar. * WHERE...Portions of central Colorado and southeast Colorado, including the following areas, in central Colorado, Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Feet and Western and Central Fremont County Below 8500 Feet. In southeast Colorado, the Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Huerfano County, the Wet Mountain Valley, and the Wet Mountains. * WHEN...From 11 AM MDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Decker, Hayden Pass, Junkins and Spring burn scar will be possible during the period of the watch. Residents near the Decker, Hayden Pass, Junkins and Spring burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over or near the burn scars, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
